scenarios.s2: Today's shift went smoothly, you served many customers.
scenarios.s3: Oops! You accidentally spilled coffee on a customer, your pay was cut for compensation.

scenarios.s1: All packages delivered on time and you got a 5-star rating!
scenarios.s2: Today's delivery route was busy, but you managed everything.
scenarios.s3: You went to the wrong address and had to turn back, wasting fuel.

scenarios.s1: You found extra change and returned it, your boss is happy!
scenarios.s2: It was crowded today, but you served customers efficiently.
scenarios.s3: A customer got angry, making you stressed and less productive.

scenarios.s1: You helped a lady park and got an extra tip!
scenarios.s2: It was hot today, but you stayed enthusiastic on the job.
scenarios.s3: A motorcycle went missing, you had to pay part of the loss.

scenarios.s1: You fixed a critical bug just before the deadline. The client is very happy!
scenarios.s2: Today's work was routine maintenance and code refactoring.
scenarios.s3: Your code caused a memory leak. You had to work overtime without pay to fix it.

scenarios.s1: Your logo design won a competition! You got a big bonus.
scenarios.s2: You spent the day making assets for a client's social media.
scenarios.s3: Client kept asking for revisions until you got dizzy. Very exhausting.

scenarios.s1: Your post went viral and the client's followers skyrocketed!
scenarios.s2: You scheduled posts and replied to comments as usual.
scenarios.s3: The client's account got hacked, you had to work extra.

scenarios.s1: Your article was published in a major media, you got a royalty bonus!
scenarios.s2: You wrote several articles as ordered.
scenarios.s3: Your writing needed lots of revisions, your pay was cut.

scenarios.s1: Your endorsement trended, you got a new contract!
scenarios.s2: You uploaded daily content and got standard engagement.
scenarios.s3: Your content was criticized by netizens, the brand delayed payment.

scenarios.s1: You got lots of orders and a 5-star rating!
scenarios.s2: Today's orders went smoothly.
scenarios.s3: You got a troublesome passenger, your rating dropped a bit.

scenarios.s1: Your goods sold out, you got a bonus from the marketplace!
scenarios.s2: Sales were stable as usual.
scenarios.s3: A buyer complained, you got a bad rating.

scenarios.s1: Your photo was used by a famous magazine, you got royalties!
scenarios.s2: You got a product photo job today.
scenarios.s3: Your smartphone camera malfunctioned, photo results were subpar.

scenarios.s1: Your project finished ahead of schedule, the client gave a big bonus!
scenarios.s2: Meetings and coordination went smoothly.
scenarios.s3: A team member suddenly resigned, the project was slightly delayed.

scenarios.s1: Your business went viral on social media, sales soared!
scenarios.s2: Business ran steadily, no major issues.
scenarios.s3: A big customer complaint forced you to give a discount.

scenarios.s1: Your solution saved a client's system from hackers!
scenarios.s2: You provided routine consulting to clients.
scenarios.s3: Client was dissatisfied with your advice, your fee was cut.

scenarios.s1: You drove your boss to an important meeting on time, got a big tip!
scenarios.s2: The trip went smoothly without obstacles.
scenarios.s3: Stuck in a traffic jam, your boss was a bit disappointed.

scenarios.s1: Your startup was acquired by a big company, you became an instant billionaire!
scenarios.s2: Business grew rapidly, investors are happy.
scenarios.s3: Investors delayed funding, cashflow was a bit disrupted.

scenarios.s1: Your property project succeeded, big profit from sales!
scenarios.s2: Property rentals went smoothly.
scenarios.s3: A tenant ran away, you lost this month's rent.

scenarios.s1: Your company won a big tender, revenue soared!
scenarios.s2: Company operations ran normally.
scenarios.s3: A sudden audit, you had to pay a fine.

scenarios.s1: Your donation went viral, many were inspired and you received an award!
scenarios.s2: You regularly helped social foundations.
scenarios.s3: There was a report of fund misuse, your reputation dropped a bit.

help.title: ## DNS Record Type Reference
help.description:
Here are the supported DNS record types, required fields, and examples.

Use `/pro dns set` to create or update records.

types.name: A (IP Address Record)
types.desc: Maps a domain/subdomain to an IPv4 address.

types.name: CNAME (Canonical Name Record)
types.desc: Aliases a domain/subdomain to another hostname (can only be used for subdomains).

types.name: TXT (Text Record)
types.desc: Stores arbitrary text, commonly used for domain verification (Google, SPF, etc).

types.name: MX (Mail Exchange Record)
types.desc: Specifies mail servers responsible for receiving email.
types.priority: Number indicating priority (lower is preferred; default: 10)
